STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
March 28, 2024
Mark Jones
Osceola Youth Center
3030 Long Lane Rd,
Evart, MI, 49639
Re: License #: CI670414130
SI #: 2024C0001140SI
Dear Mr. Jones:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• Indicate how continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• Be signed and dated.
A six-month provisional license is recommended. You must contest or agree to the
issuance of a provisional license in writing, on the CWL-4617 within 15 days, with
submission of the corrective action plan. If you do not submit the CWL-4617, it will be
treated as contested. Even if you contest the issuance of a provisional license, you must
still submit an acceptable corrective action plan.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2024C0001140SI
Special Investigation Intake Date: February 12, 2024
License #: CI670414130
Licensee Group Organization: Youth Opportunity Investments, LLC
Licensee Designee: Tyrene Reginald Green
Chief Administrator: Mark Jones
Agency Name: Osceola Youth Center
Agency Address: 3030 Long Lane Rd
Evart, MI 49639
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 01/01/2026
Capacity: 16

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff pushed youth across room and held him up against the wall.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on February 12,
2024, and reported they had no further information.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 13, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
2

Director reported Unit Manager was placed on administrative
leave on February 12, 2024. Director stated Unit Manager has
worked for the facility for three months and was frustrated to learn
he was being placed on administrative leave.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 13, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth
A described getting angry with Youth B when playing Monopoly.
Youth A stated he flipped over a table, pushed, and hit Unit
Manager then Unit Manager pushed Youth A up against the wall
and placed his forearm on Youth A’s neck. Youth A reported Unit
Manager pushed his forearm into Youth A’s neck making it a little
bit hard to breath while having his other hand pressed into Youth
A’s chest. Youth A reported Unit Manager was yelling and saying
something about charges being brought up against Youth A for
assault and Youth A’s parents continuing to have to pay for
damages caused by Youth A. Youth A reported Supervisor and
Medical Technician (Med Tech) entered the room, restrained
Youth A’s arms then released Youth A. Youth A stated he was
still mad, so he continued to flip tables and pull over a large
bookshelf. Youth A described finding a small piece of plastic and
using it to cut the top of his hand. Youth A reported the cut started
to bleed so Unit Manager pulled down Youth A’s thumb with one
hand while using his other hand to pull away his fingers so Youth
A would release the plastic. Youth A stated his thumb hurt from
Unit Manager pulling it down. Youth A reported Youth B and
Youth C were removed from the room by Med Tech when Youth A
started to get upset so they did not witness Unit Manager have his
forearm on Youth A’s neck. Youth A denied seeing Unit Manager
do this to any other youth. Youth A stated he does not feel safe at
the facility and would like to return home.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 13, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth
B described Youth A getting upset while playing Monopoly and
start yelling. Youth B reported he had to leave the room when
Youth A started getting upset so did not see anything between
Youth A and Unit Manager. Youth B stated he heard Unit
Manager yell at Youth A something about “that’s assault.” Youth
B denied seeing Unit Manager push Youth A against the wall.
Youth B stated he did not have any concerns with staff or how
restraints are completed.
Medical Technician (Med Tech) was interviewed face to face
at the facility on February 13, 2024, in collaboration with
DHHS Worker. Med Tech described Youth A getting upset
3

playing Monopoly, so she removed Youth B and Youth C from the
area. Med Tech reported while she had them leave the room, she
heard Youth A say “no, no, no” so she looked back into the room
and saw Unit Manager holding Youth A against the wall with his
forearm against Youth A’s throat. Med Tech stated she ran into
the room to get Unit Manager’s forearm off Youth A’s neck and to
get Youth A to stop punching Unit Manager. Med Tech stated
Supervisor was in the hallway and she also ran into the room to
assist. Med Tech described placing Youth A in a multi-person
upper torso restraint with Supervisor’s assistance. Med Tech
reported once they had Youth A’s arms she told Unit Manager to
go, she had him. Med Tech stated Youth A was able to slide out
of the restraint so Supervisor and her released Youth A and
continued to talk with Youth A. Med Tech reported Youth A was
still escalated flipping over desks, chair, and a bookcase. Med
Tech stated Youth A found a piece of plastic and cut the top of his
hand, making his hand bleed. Med Tech reported Unit Manager
got the piece of plastic by using both of his hands to pry open
Youth A’s hand to make him drop the plastic. Med Tech stated
Unit Manager was pulling down on Youth A’s thumb, Youth A
yelled “ow” and dropped the plastic. Med Tech stated Unit
Manager was inappropriately yelling at Youth A while in the room.
Med Tech reported she could not recall the words Unit Manager
was yelling but it was more his tone and not using the correct de-
escalation techniques. Med Tech reported staff should never
place their forearm on a youth’s throat or yell like Unit Manager
did at Youth A. Med Tech stated how Unit Manager responded to
Youth A is not how the facility trains staff to de-escalate and
interact with youth. Med Tech reported Unit Manager pulling
Youth A’s thumb down is not the correct finger peel method taught
to have a youth release an object the youth is holding. Med Tech
stated she has had concerns with Unit Manager antagonizing
youth in the past and shared her concerns. Med Tech reported
she called Director the following morning with her concerns
regarding Unit Manager. Med Tech stated Unit Manager was the
person in charge that shift. Med Tech reported she examined
Youth A’s neckline and there was no bruising or scratches. Med
Tech stated Youth A denied having any pain or trouble breathing
after the incident.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 13, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Supervisor described being the extra person on shift that night.
Supervisor stated Youth A got upset playing Monopoly and drew
his fist back on Youth C. Supervisor reported she intervened and
moved Youth C out the door and away from Youth A while Unit
4

Manager stepped toward Youth A. Supervisor described Youth A
continuing to get upset, flipping over chairs and tables so she
grabbed the television to remove from the room. Supervisor
stated while she was moving the television to the conference
room, she could hear Youth A and Unit Manager screaming at one
another. Supervisor stated she yelled to Med Tech, turned to look
back in the room and saw Unit Manager holding Youth A against
the wall with his forearm at Youth A’s neckline while Youth A was
hitting Unit Manager. Supervisor described Youth A being on his
toes with his neck stretched up. Supervisor reported Med Tech
and her ran into the room and did a multi-person double upper
torso restraint on Youth A. Supervisor stated Med Tech told Unit
Manager to “move” and he stepped away from Youth A.
Supervisor reported Youth A became loose in the restraint so was
released. Supervisor reported Youth A continued to walk around
the room flipping over chairs and a bookcase. Supervisor stated
Youth A got a piece of plastic and used it to cut the top of his
hand. Supervisor described Unit Manager using his hands to peel
Youth A’s thumb back to have Youth A drop the plastic.
Supervisor reported when Unit Manager did this Youth A yelled
out. Supervisor stated the finger peel method does not pull the
thumb down. Supervisor described Unit Manager as being “pretty
pissed” as he was yelling at Youth A. Supervisor stated she could
not recall what Unit Manager was saying but you could tell he was
“pissed.” Supervisor described Unit Manager was yelling
matching Youth A’s tone, which is not how staff should de-
escalate a youth. Supervisor reported Unit Manager did not use
the proper technique with Youth A and there is no approved staff
intervention holding a youth up against the wall using one’s
forearm. Supervisor stated she did not talk with anyone about her
concern with how Unit Manager handled the situation. Supervisor
reported Unit Manager was the person in charge that shift, and
Unit Manager contacted Director. Supervisor denied being
present during the conversation so was not aware what
information Unit Manager gave Director. Supervisor reported she
figured staff would debrief today, two days after the incident.
Unit Manager was interviewed via telephone on February 14,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was face to
face with Unit Manager in DHHS Worker’s office. Unit
Manager described being in the classroom with Youth A, Youth B,
and Youth C supervising them while they were sitting playing
Monopoly. Unit Manager stated Youth A became upset with
Youth C. Youth A stood up and took a swing at Youth C. Unit
Manager reported he got Youth A away from Youth C and Med
Tech moved Youth B and Youth C out of the classroom. Unit
5

Manager described Youth A continuing to yell, pace around the
room and flip over desks. Unit Manager stated he was talking with
Youth A the entire time trying to de-escalate Youth A. Unit
Manager reported Youth A pushed and punched him and
continued to escalate. Unit Manager stated he kept asking Youth
A what he was thinking, kept reminding Youth A of his pending
charges and what he needed to do to leave the facility. Unit
Manager reported Youth A continued to escalate and pushed Unit
Manager again and punched him several more times. Unit
Manager stated due to Youth A’s continued assault he pushed
Youth A up against the wall with his arm. Unit Manager stated
staff are not trained to do that, but he was trying to block Youth A
from hitting him in the head and face repeatedly. Unit Manager
described moving his arm around when he had Youth A pressed
against the wall, not trying to go against Youth A’s throat, but
more against Youth A’s chest area and collarbone. Unit Manager
stated he finally got Youth A’s arms up. Unit Manager reported he
normally does not do this; he takes the shot to the face but did not
know what else he was supposed to do to protect himself in that
situation. Unit Manager stated he did not use a Safe Crisis
Management hold on Youth A. Unit Manager described
Supervisor and Med Tech coming into assist, and they placed
Youth A in a two person hold while Unit Supervisor moved away
from Youth A. Unit Supervisor denied trying to hurt Youth A. Unit
Supervisor stated due to Youth A’s size and strength Supervisor
and Med Tech could not continue to hold Youth A in the restraint,
so they released Youth A. Unit Manager reported Youth A was
still escalated and continued to pace around the room flipping over
desks, a bookshelf and using a piece of plastic to cut his hand.
Unit Manager reported using the finger peel method on Youth A to
get the plastic out of Youth A’s hand.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of February 11, 2024, was reviewed on February
13, 2024, at the facility in collaboration with DHHS Worker. There
is no sound on the video. Video shows Youth A, Youth B, and
Youth C sitting on the floor playing Monopoly with Unit Manger
standing in the classroom supervising. Video footage shows
Youth A become upset, pick up a desk, flip it to the side and then it
appears Youth A and Unit Manager are saying something to one
another. Unit Manager takes a step toward Youth A, Youth A then
moves toward Unit Manager and pushes him. Unit Manager takes
a few steps back from being pushed by Youth A then walks toward
Youth A continuing to what appears to talk with Youth A. Youth A
punches Unit Manager in the stomach. Video shows Med Tech
6

move Youth B and Youth C out of the classroom. It appears Unit
Manager and Youth A are still talking with one another. Supervisor
is seen moving a desk and walking away from the area. Youth A
is seen pushing Unit Manager causing him to step back while
Youth A then punches Unit Manager three times. Unit Manager
uses his left hand to grab Youth A’s right arm and pushes Youth A
across the classroom up against the wall. Video shows once
Youth A is up against the wall Unit Manager has his right arm
pressed against Youth A’s throat and face. Youth A is seen trying
to hit Unit Manager on the top of his head with both hands. Unit
Manager continues to hold his right arm on Youth A’s throat. Med
Tech and Supervisor are seen running into the classroom and
secure both of Youth A’s arms. Unit Manager releases and walks
away from Youth A but stays in the classroom. Youth A is seen
fighting the restraint, Med Tech, and Supervisor release Youth A.
Youth A walks around the classroom, flipping over desks and a
bookshelf. No other physical contact is seen on the video.
Documents Reviewed:
• Unit Manager’s Personnel File: There were no disciplinary
actions and Unit Manager completed Safe Crisis
Management training on 10/14/2023.
• Youth Opportunity Investment Safe Crisis Management Use
of Physical Intervention Report for Youth A completed by
Supervisor. Incident report reflects what is seen on the
video footage as well as Supervisor’s interview.
• Youth Opportunity Investment Safe Crisis Management Use
of Physical Intervention Report for Youth A completed by
Med Tech. Incident report reflects what is seen on the
video footage as well as Med Tech’s interview.
• Youth Opportunity Investment Safe Crisis Management Use
of Physical Intervention Report for Youth A completed by
Unit Manager. Incident Report reflects the restraint as a
front restraint with no mention of the forearm being used.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 174520217 for Youth A: Incident report
accurately reflects what is seen on the video footage as
well as Med Tech’s interview.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 174520218 for Youth A: Incident report
describes Unit Manager using an “upper torso restraint” on
Youth A with no mention of Unit Manager’s forearm
placement on Youth A.
7

• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 174540219 for Youth A: Incident report
describes Unit Manager using a “front restraint” with no
mention of Unit Manager’s forearm placement on Youth A.
• Osceola Youth Center Policy, Standards of Conduct:
Includes the expectation staff are to interact with youth in a
manner promoting their emotional and physical safety.
• Agency Response Plan provided to Consultant on
2/12/2024: Unit Manager has been placed on
administrative leave and will remain in place pending the
outcome of the investigation.
• Youth Opportunity Investments Post Physical Assessment
for Youth A dated 2/11/2024: Report states “no marks on
youth.”
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as video shows Unit
Manager push Youth A across the room and hold Youth A against
the wall by placing his forearm against Youth A’s throat.
Interviews with Med Tech, Supervisor and Youth A report Unit
Manager had his forearm pressed against Youth A’s throat or
neck area. Interviews with Med Tech and Supervisor described
Unit Manager as yelling at Youth A and being “pissed.”
Interviews with Med Tech and Supervisor described Unit Manager
not using the correct finger peel technique on Youth A to retrieve a
piece of plastic Youth A used to cut his hand. Youth A, Supervisor
and Med Tech described Unit Manager pulling Youth A’s thumb
down causing Youth A to yell out. Supervisor stated in the finger
peel technique the thumb is not pulled down.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
Title qualifications
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Unit Manager lacks the ability to recognize his actions toward
Youth A escalated the situation, took no responsibility and
8

believes his actions were the correct way to intervene with Youth
A.
Investigation Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 13, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Director reported Unit Manager was placed on administrative
leave on February 12, 2024. Director stated Unit Manager has
worked for the facility for three months and was frustrated to learn
he was being placed on administrative leave.
Medical Technician (Med Tech) was interviewed face to face
at the facility on February 13, 2024, in collaboration with
DHHS Worker. Med Tech stated Unit Manager was
inappropriately yelling at Youth A while in the room. Med Tech
reported she could not recall the words Unit Manager was yelling
but it was more his tone and not using the correct de-escalation
techniques. Med Tech reported staff should never place their
forearm on a youth’s throat or yell like Unit Manager did at Youth
A. Med Tech stated how Unit Manager responded to Youth A is
not how the facility trains staff to de-escalate and interact with
youth. Med Tech stated she has had concerns with Unit Manager
antagonizing youth in the past and shared her concerns. Med
Tech reported she called Director the following morning with her
concerns regarding Unit Manager. Med Tech stated Unit Manager
was the person in charge that shift.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 13, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Supervisor described Unit Manager as being “pretty pissed” as he
was yelling at Youth A. Supervisor stated she could not recall
what Unit Manager was saying but could tell he was “pissed.”
Supervisor described Unit Manager was yelling matching Youth
A’s tone, which is not how staff should de-escalate a youth.
Supervisor reported Unit Manager did not use the proper
technique with Youth A and there is no approved staff intervention
holding a youth up against the wall using one’s forearm.
Unit Manager was interviewed via telephone on February 14,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was face to
face with Unit Manager in DHHS Worker’s office. Unit
Manager stated due to Youth A’s continued assault he pushed
Youth A up against the wall with his arm. Unit Manager stated
staff are not trained to do that, but he was trying to block Youth A
from hitting him in the head and face repeatedly. Unit Manager
described moving his arm around when he had Youth A pressed
against the wall, not trying to go against Youth A’s throat but more
9

against Youth A’s chest area and collarbone. Unit Manager
reported he normally does not do this; he takes the shot to the
face but did not know what else he was supposed to do to protect
himself in that situation. Unit Manager stated he did not use a
Safe Crisis Management hold on Youth A.
Unit Manager denied having his arm on Youth A’s throat and
stated his arm was on Youth A’s collarbone. Unit Manager
reported from the angle of the camera it may look like his arm was
on Youth A’s throat but denied it ever was. Unit Manager stated
he felt like he did what he needed to do to keep other youth and
himself safe in that situation. Unit Manager reported the correct
technique could not be used on Youth A so Unit Manager did what
he had to do to stop Youth A. Unit Manager reported he was the
only one there that could hold Youth A due to Youth A’s size and
strength. Unit Manager stated Youth A was able to get out of the
hold with Supervisor and Med Tech. Unit Manager reported he did
files assault charges on Youth A.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of February 11, 2024, was reviewed on February
13, 2024, at the facility in collaboration with DHHS Worker. There
is no sound on the video. Video shows Unit Manager holding his
arms up and approaching Youth A instead of backing away to de-
escalate the situation. Video also showed Unit Manager using his
harm and pressing into Youth A’s neck.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as interviewing Unit
Manager he reported not recognizing any of his actions toward
Youth A as escalating the situation or understanding his actions
were inappropriate. Unit Manager defended placing his forearm
against Youth A as the only means to stop Youth A from hitting
Unit Manager.
Technical Assistance:
It is recommended the facility review their hiring and promoting
practice of staff. Unit Manager did not have experience working
with youth in a CCI setting.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2024C0000939SI dated 01/09/2024; CAP approved 02/08/2024
2023C0000770SI dated 10/18/2023; CAP Approved 11/16/2023
10

Rule Code Health status assessment; notification; debriefing; reporting.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163
Section (5) An agency will provide an incident report on a form prescribed
Description by the department for each incident involving the use of seclusion
or restraint. The initial report shall be submitted to the department
within 24 hours of the incident occurring. A final incident report
shall be submitted no later than 72 hours after the incident has
occurred.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth A's incident reports were not completed within the required
time frame.
Investigation When reviewing documentation of Youth A’s restraint, I noticed
the incident reports were submitted two days after the incident
occurred. Youth A’s restraint occurred on 2/11/2024 and were
submitted on 02/13/2024.
Documents Reviewed:
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 174520217 for Youth A: Date of incident
2/11/2024, incident report submitted date 2/13/24.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 174520218 for Youth A: Date of incident
2/11/2024, incident report submitted date 2/13/24.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 174540219 for Youth A: Date of incident
2/11/2024, incident report submitted date 2/13/24, as of
03/08/24 incident report is still in draft status.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance of the rule for submitting the
incident reports two days after the restraint occurred.
Technical Assistance:
It is recommended one incident report be entered into MiSACWIS
for one restraint. The internal supporting incident reports should
be retained and uploaded as supporting documentation. Youth
A’s restraint had three incident reports uploaded for the same
restraint.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2024C0000956SI dated 01/12/2024; CAP approved 02/08/2024
2024C0000939SI dated 01/09/2024; CAP approved 02/08/2024
11

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the license be modified to a First Provisional license.
March 8, 2024
______________________________________________________________________
Barbara A Cote Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
March 12, 2024
______________________________________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
12
